title: Organization
body: This course guide will give you an overview of the learning goals, structure and organisation of the course and the different types of learning material and techniques you will encounter during the course.
pageBody: This course guide will give you an overview of the learning goals, structure and organisation of the course and the different types of learning material and techniques you will encounter during the course.

title: System-Context Boundaries and Types of Requirements
displayTitle: System-Context Boundaries and Types of Requirements
body: In this lecture, you will learn what differentiates systems and context, what different types of boundaries exist and why they are important for the RE process.
subtitle: Lecture L02
pageBody: In this lecture, you will learn what differentiates systems and context, what different types of boundaries exist and why they are important for the RE process.

title: Elicitation Part 1
body: Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process. Part 1 gives a general overview of the elicitation process and introduces some techniques.
subtitle: Lecture L03
pageBody: Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process. Part 1 gives a general overview of the elicitation process and introduces some techniques.

title: Introduction and Document Structure
body: In the first part of the lecture, we will cover the introduction to documentation, criteria for good requirements, document structure and document templates.
subtitle: Lecture L05
pageBody: In the first part of the lecture, we will cover the introduction to documentation, criteria for good requirements, document structure and document templates.

title: Introduction to Different Types of Models
displayTitle: Introduction to Different Types of Models
body: Documentation models are frameworks or structures used to systematically capture and communicate information about a system or a process. They play a crucial role in requirements and software engineering, and other fields where complex systems need to be conceptualized, analyzed, and communicated.
subtitle: Lecture L06
pageBody: The first part of this lecture will give you an introduction to documentation models in general and give you an overview over goal models, use cases, looking at the data, functional and behavioural perspective and introduce you to agent oriented modelling.

title: Traceability
body: Tracing requirements allows you to analyse and understand the relations among requirements, requirements sources and development artefacts.
subtitle: Lecture L09
pageBody: Tracing requirements allows you to analyse and understand the relations among requirements, requirements sources and development artefacts.

title: Change Management
body: Change management is a systematic process within project management that entails evaluating, implementing, and controlling alterations to a project's scope, requirements, or objectives.
subtitle: Lecture L08
pageBody: Change management is a systematic process within project management that entails evaluating, implementing, and controlling alterations to a project's scope, requirements, or objectives. It aims to ensure effective adaptation to evolving circumstances while maintaining project coherence and minimizing disruptions.

title: Exercise
body: Here you can find the multiple choice questions for L02 of the Requirements Engineering course. It will cover both the content of the introductory lecture and the second lecture.
subtitle: Multiple Choice Quiz

title: Introduction
body: In this lecture, you will find out why Requirements Engineering is essential for software and systems engineers, get an overview of what it is and what the different steps of the process entail.
subtitle: Lecture L01

title: Elicitation Part 2
body: In part 2 of the lecture on requirements elicitation, you will be introduced to some additional techniques to elicit information and get a summary of the whole process.
subtitle: Lecture L03

title: Guidelines and Specifications
body: The second part of the lecture on documentation, covers textual requirements specification, the challenges of ambiguity, te importance of guidelines and syntactic requirements patterns.
subtitle: Lecture L05
pageBody: The second part of the lecture on documentation, covers textual requirements specification, the challenges of ambiguity, the importance of guidelines and syntactic requirements patterns.

title: Colored Petri Nets
body: Documentation models are frameworks or structures used to systematically capture and communicate information about a system or a process. They play a crucial role in requirements and software engineering, and other fields where complex systems need to be conceptualized, analyzed, and communicated.
subtitle: Lecture L06
pageBody:
1. Introduction and CPNs
In this segment, we will discuss Colored Petri Nets (CPNs). CPNs are modelling language that allows us to represent systems with complex interactions and parallel processes. They use colors to convey additional information, enabling a more nuanced representation of system behaviour. We'll explore the basics of CPNs and understand how they are powerful tools for modelling and analysing dynamic systems.

2. AOM â†’ CPN Mapping
Moving on, we explore the connection between Agent-Oriented Modeling (AOM) that we discussed previously and Colored Petri Nets through a mapping process. AOM, focusing on intelligent agents and decentralised control, brings a unique perspective to system modelling. We'll unravel how AOM concepts can be translated and mapped onto CPNs.

3. Summary
As we conclude our lecture on documentation models, CPNs, and AOM mappings, we gather the key insights and takeaways.

title: Elicitation
body: This lecture introduces different techniques to elicit the correct information from various stakeholders and sources. Elicitation is the first and one of the most crucial steps during the Requirements Engineering process.

title: Negotiation
body: During the negotiation phase all stakeholders have to gain a common understanding of the requirements. Conflict management plays a vital part during the negotiation.
subtitle: Lecture L04
pageBody: During the negotiation phase all stakeholders have to gain a common understanding of the requirements. Conflict management plays a vital part during the negotiation.

title: Documentation
body: During the requirements engineering process, documentation is essential to ensure a successful collaboration. Here, you will be introduced to different documentation techniques.
pageBody: During the requirements engineering process, documentation is essential to ensure a successful collaboration. Here, you will be introduced to different documentation techniques.

title: Validation
body: The validation steps of the Requirements Engineering process ensures that the implemented requirements are consistent with and meet the stakeholder's needs.
subtitle: Lecture L07

title: Tool Support
body: Tool support for Requirements Engineering (RE) refers to the use of software tools designed to facilitate and enhance various aspects of the requirements management process.
subtitle: Lecture L10
pageBody: Tool support for Requirements Engineering (RE) refers to the use of software tools designed to facilitate and enhance various aspects of the requirements management process. These tools assist in capturing, analyzing, documenting, and tracking requirements throughout the project lifecycle. They often provide features such as requirement elicitation, traceability, version control, collaboration, and visualization, contributing to increased efficiency, accuracy, and collaboration within the RE process.
